MELANOSTRUM_QUOTE: What is MelaNostrum?   A consensus Questionnaire of standardized epidemiologic and clinical variables for melanoma risk assessment by the melanostrum consortium.
MELANOSTRUM_CONSORTIUM:
By who is composed the consortium? MelaNostrum is comprised of researchers and clinicians from Mediterranean Countries (Greece, Italy, and Spain) and investigators at the US National Cancer Institute (NCI) Division of Cancer Epidemiology and Genetics (DCEG). 
      The consortium was established in 2014 to pursue research studies on the genetics of familial and sporadic melanoma.
MELANOSTRUM_PURPOSE: What is the purpose? The main goals of the MelaNostrum are the identification of: i. novel genetic variants associated with increased susceptibility to melanoma in Southern European Countries (Mediterranean area); ii. biomarkers that could aid in the molecular classification of melanoma and in the elucidation of melanoma progression.
SECTION_A1_3_TITLE: Enter the date of questionnaire administration and phenotyping
SECTION_A1_3_HINT: Format DD/MMM/YYYY. Use a 3-letter abbreviation for month to avoid misinterpretation (US vs. European style)
SECTION_A1_4_TITLE: Type of melanoma (if subject is a melanoma case)
SECTION_A1_4_HINT: Use a 3-letter abbreviation for month to avoid misinterpretation (US vs. European style)
SECTION_A2_2_TITLE: Enter the place of birth and date
SECTION_A2_2_DATE_PLACEHOLDER_HINT: Format DD/MMM/YYYY. Use a 3-letter abbreviation for month to avoid misinterpretation (US vs. European style)
SECTION_A2_6_EDUC_OPTION_1: Up to junior high school (up to 14-16 yrs)
SECTION_B1_1_LABEL_1: Which of the following sentences does better describe your skin response to sun exposure at noon for 30 minutes in the first days of the summer without sunscreen/clothing protection?
SECTION_B1_1_LABEL_2: Does your skin tan after a prolonged and repeated sun exposure (e.g. after several days as at the end of the summer) without protecting it with sunscreen or clothing?
SECTION_B1_3_TITLE: Specify your hair color (at age of 18 yrs)
SECTION_B1_4_LABEL: Definition: Light brown small macules since childhood, on the face, during summer time (disappear in winter)
